results.title: The Fruits of passion = Les Fruits de la passion (E)
results.creator_credit: Argos Films, Terayama Productions, Anatole Dauman, Hiroko Govaers and Shuji Terayama
results.brief_description: A sexually explicit drama, “The Fruits of passion” is the sequel to “The Story of O”. Set in Hong Kong, 1920, the wealthy Sir Stephen is owner of a casino and living in delightful decadence, indulging in a multitude of amorous experiences. Stephen persuades his wife O to join him there and work in a brothel, as a means of demonstrating her love for him. Once there she is exposed to all manner of sexual peccadillos and perversions, frequently enacted whilst Stephen watches. Stephen embarks upon an affair with another woman, whilst O finds a new love of her own, challenging their marriage. “The Fruits of passion” is art-house fare that dabbles in soft porn, with a political backdrop. Although it toys with the themes of fidelity and eroticism, the film tends toward misogyny and spends an inordinate amount of time on the sexual proclivities of its protagonists but little on their mental states or emotional motivations. Based on the novel by Pauline Reage (aka Dominique Aury), who wrote the erotic classic, “The Story of O”. Warning - strong sexual content.

results.title: The Frozen flame
results.brief_description: When natural gas is cooled to minus 161 degrees centigrade it becomes a liquid: liquified natural gas, or LNG. In 1959, Shell participated in the first ocean crossing of a cargo of LNG, marking the genesis of the modern LNG industry. In this video, projects in Brunei, Japan, Malaysia and Australia illustrate Shell’s history in the LNG business across management, finance, shipping and supply.

results.title: The Frog princess
results.creator_credit: Paul N Peroff and Coronet Instructional Films
results.brief_description: An animated film which tells the story of a prince in search of a bride. He shoots an arrow into the air with the intention of marrying whoever finds it. But it is found by a frog, who is really an enchanted princess. Together they have many adventures until she is released from the spell.

results.title: The Frog prince (Muppets)
results.creator_credit: Henson Associates, Robert Lawrence Productions and Jim Henson
results.brief_description: Sir Robin, the bravest prince is turned into a frog by an ogre. The only cure to revert him to his human form is to receive a kiss from a Princess, to lift the spell. Starring Trudy Young as the Princess and Gordon Thomson as the Prince, as well as the muppet performers.

results.title: The Frog prince
results.brief_description: This is one of the beautifully made Lotte reiniger silhouette puppet films of the traditional fairy story. To decide which of his daughters should marry next, the king tosses each of them a golden ball, which the youngest one catches. She accidentally drops it down a well and it is recovered by a frog who is later transformed into a handsome man.

results.title: The Frog's world
results.brief_description: Life cycle and habits of the different species of frogs and toads which live in the Japanese rice fields; how to catch them and care for them in an aquarium. The large number of eggs and tadpoles appearing each year is soon reduced by predators such as the newt, drgaon fly larvae and the water mantis. Titles and credits in Japanese. English commentary.

results.title: The Frog
results.creator_credit: Clyde Fisher and ERPI Classroom Films
results.brief_description: Life cycle of the frog is presented. The development of the embryo is brought to the screen in a continuous scene of only a few seconds. The several changes taking place in the tadpole stages are portrayed by picture and narrative. Slow-motion photography demonstrates the graceful movements of the frog in jumping.

results.title: The Fringe dwellers
results.creator_credit: Sue Milliken, Fringe Dwellers Productions, Oz Films and Bruce Beresford
results.brief_description: This adaptation of Nene Gare’s novel about contemporary life among Australian aborigines shows them as outcasts in their own country, despised by the whites, disinclined to work at the menial jobs they can get, and with a big partiality to alcohol. The Comeaway family is persuaded by their 15 year old daughter Trilby to move from the shanty town to a new estate. She is determined not to fall into the same overbreeding, underachieving trap as the women around her, but finds that events conspire against her.
